text: Iraota rochana, the scarce silverstreak, is a species of lycaenid or blue butterfly with several subspecies found in Manipur, Myanmar, Java, Borneo, Sumatra, Malaya, Langkawi, Thailand, Singapore, Sulawesi and the Philippines. The species was first described by Thomas Horsfield in 1829. ==Subspecies== The subspecies of Iraota rochana found in India are: * Iraota rochana boswelliana Distant, 1885 – Malayan scarce silverstreak blue ==Gallery== Image:IraotaRochanaMaleCompositeAC1.jpg|Male from Brunei Image:Close wing position of male Iraota rochana Horsfield, 1829 – Scarce Silverstreak Blue.jpg|West Bengal, India ==References== Category:Amblypodiini Category:Butterflies of India Category:Butterflies of Singapore Category:Butterflies of Borneo
title: Iraota rochana
